page.title: 06NAFFIT'S FARM
page.content: There are two farms in this area, Naffit's Farm and Grange Farm. Both farms are occupied. About 80% of the land is arable, with the remaining 20% being grazing. Some of the fields contained cattle, and there were a few sheep to be seen. Running north-south in the area is a class 2 road, the B1363, which leads from York to Helmsley. The south west corner of the area is crossed by energy pylons. All fields are bordered by well-established hawthorn hedges, which are in some places very overgrown. However the hedge bordering the B1363 is much tidier. The grass verges by the road had been trimmed recently. A right of way runs from the B1363 in an easterly direction to join Bull Lane at Rosecroft Farm.
